text:
Question 87) The shape of multicellular organism cells is extremely varied. There are disc cells, such as red blood cells, those that resemble a star, such as neurons, and some elongated, such as muscle.
In the same organism, the differentiation of these cells occurs by
A) produce specific mutations.
B) have different mitochondrial DNA.
C) present a set of distinct genes.
D) express different portions of the genome.
E) have a distinct number of chromosomes.
